H ow can we tell if u = (V1. V:2, II]. II~) is in the row space? The slow way is 10 
combine rows. The quick way is by onhogonality: 
II is ill the row space if Qlld only ifit is ~rpemJicular to (l, I, 1, I) ill the nullspace. 
lhe vector II = (0. 1.2,3) fails this test-its components add to 6. The vector (-6. 1,2.3) 
passes the test. It lies in the row space because its components add to zero. It equals 
6(row I) + 5(row 3) + 3(row 6).
